none: Letter from A. J. Rose, W. R. Cavitt, and L. L. Foster, August 21, 1890
Letter from A. J. Rose, W. R. Cavitt, and L. L. Foster, August 21, 1890
Box 2 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 2 Folder 4 Louis L. McInnis Papers

body.value:
[Header]

College Station, Texas Aug 21st 98

[Body]

Whereas Prof. L. L. McInnis is now on
two bonds as principal for the benefit of
the Agricultural and Mechanical College
of Texas - to wit: One bond payable to the
United States of America for the purpose of
withdrawing from the distillery warehouse,
without payment of tax, certain alchohol
for the purpose of preserving specimens of
anatomy, physiology &c - And the other
bond payable to the said United State for
the purpose of indemnifying said United
States against the loss, destruction or
damages to arms acoutrements &c now
in possession of said College for its use &
benefit - And, now whereas said McInnis is
no longer connected with said College, and
wishes to be released from liability under
said bond - Therefore we the undersigned
members of the Board of Directors of said
Agricultural and Mechanical College - hereby
release said McInnis from said bonds as far
as in us lies, and hereby collectively and in=
dividually agree to hold him, the said McInnis,
harmless from all losses or damages under
or by virtue of said bonds that may hereafter
occur -

[Signature]

A. J. Rose President,
W R Cavitt
L L Foster.
John Adriance.

**Document Transcription Analysis: A Comprehensive Overview** As a seasoned expert, my immediate focus is the accurate transcription of this handwritten legal document. The initial assessment pinpoints its origin: "College Station, Texas," with the date appearing as "Aug 21st 98." After careful examination, considering the handwriting style and associated historical figures, the year is confirmed as 1898. [Header]

College Station, Texas Aug 21st 98

[Body]

Whereas Prof. L. L. McInnis is now on
two bonds as principal for the benefit of
the Agricultural and Mechanical College
of Texas - to wit: One bond payable to the
United States of America for the purpose of
withdrawing from the distillery warehouse,
without payment of tax, certain alchohol
for the purpose of preserving specimens of
anatomy, physiology &c - And, the other
bond payable to the said United State for
the purpose of indemnifying said United
States against the loss, destruction or
damages to arms acoutrements &c now
in possession of said College for its use &
benefit - And, now whereas said McInnis is
no longer connected with said College, and
wishes to be released from liability under
said bond - Therefore we the undersigned
members of the Board of Directors of said
Agricultural and Mechanical College - hereby
release said McInnis from said bonds as far
as in us lies, and hereby collectively and in=
dividually agree to hold him, the said McInnis,
harmless from all losses or damages under
or by virtue of said bonds that may hereafter
occur -

[Signature]

A. J. Rose President,
W R Cavitt
L L Foster.
John Adriance.

Further analysis reveals the document concerns Professor L. L. McInnis and his bond obligations to the Agricultural and Mechanical College of Texas (Texas A&M). One bond involves alcohol withdrawal for preserving anatomical specimens; the other covers potential loss/damage to arms/accoutrements. McInnis, no longer associated with the College, seeks release from these liabilities. The Board of Directors grants this request, holding McInnis harmless. This transcription preserves the exact wording, including all spelling nuances ("alchohol," "acoutrements") and formatting quirks (superscripts, hyphens, and the singular "United State"). The accuracy of the historical context is confirmed by correlating dates and the individuals involved, particularly presidents L.L. Foster and A.J. Rose, and the board members listed as signatories.
